derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hysope (reinforced in Middle English by Old French ysope), via Latin from Greek hyssōpos, of Semitic origin

means.word_mean: 1. a European mint with aromatic and pungent leaves used in perfumery and as a seasoning in cookery; often cultivated as a remedy for bruises; yields hyssop oil
2. bitter leaves used sparingly in salads; dried flowers used in soups and tisanes
